author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 18. Sañcetaniyavagga
segments.en: 18. Intention

segments.pli: 174. Ānandasutta
segments.en: 174. With Ānanda

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yenāyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākoṭṭhikena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṃ mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Ānanda sat down to one side, and said to Mahākoṭṭhita:

segments.pli: “Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthaññaṃ kiñcī”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend, when these six fields of contact have faded away and ceased with nothing left over, does anything else exist?”

segments.pli: “Mā hevaṃ, āvuso”.
segments.en: “Don’t put it like that, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā natthaññaṃ kiñcī”ti?
segments.en: “Does nothing else exist?”

segments.pli: “Mā hevaṃ, āvuso”.
segments.en: “Don’t put it like that, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthi ca natthi ca aññaṃ kiñcī”ti?
segments.en: “Do both something else and nothing else exist?”

segments.pli: “Mā hevaṃ, āvuso”.
segments.en: “Don’t put it like that, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā nevatthi no natthaññaṃ kiñcī”ti?
segments.en: “Do neither something else nor nothing else exist?”

segments.pli: “Mā hevaṃ, āvuso”.
segments.en: “Don’t put it like that, reverend.”

segments.pli: “‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthaññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
segments.en: “Reverend, when asked these questions,

segments.pli: ‘mā hevaṃ, āvuso’ti vadesi.
segments.en: you say ‘don’t put it like that’.

segments.pli: ‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā natthaññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
‘mā hevaṃ, āvuso’ti vadesi.
‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthi ca natthi ca aññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
‘mā hevaṃ, āvuso’ti vadesi.
‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā nevatthi no natthaññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
‘mā hevaṃ, āvuso’ti vadesi.
Yathā kathaṃ panāvuso, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
segments.en: … How then should we see the meaning of this statement?”

segments.pli: “‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthaññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti vadaṃ appapañcaṃ papañceti.
segments.en: “If you say that ‘when the six fields of contact have faded away and ceased with nothing left over, something else exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.

segments.pli: ‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā natthaññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti vadaṃ appapañcaṃ papañceti.
segments.en: If you say that ‘nothing else exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.

segments.pli: ‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā atthi ca natthi ca aññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti vadaṃ appapañcaṃ papañceti.
segments.en: If you say that ‘both something else and nothing else exist’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.

segments.pli: ‘Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā nevatthi no natthaññaṃ kiñcī’ti, iti vadaṃ appapañcaṃ papañceti.
segments.en: If you say that ‘neither something else nor nothing else exist’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.

segments.pli: Yāvatā, āvuso, channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ gati tāvatā papañcassa gati.
segments.en: The scope of the six fields of contact extends as far as the scope of proliferation.

segments.pli: Yāvatā papañcassa gati tāvatā channaṃ phassāyatanānaṃ gati.
segments.en: The scope of proliferation extends as far as the scope of the six fields of contact.

segments.pli: Channaṃ, āvuso, phassāyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā papañcanirodho papañcavūpasamo”ti.
segments.en: When the six fields of contact fade away and cease with nothing left over, proliferation stops and is stilled.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, and…

suttaplex.blurb: When the senses end, is there anything left? Or is that just proliferation?
